title: Tulsidas
summary: Tulsidas (Hindi pronunciation: [t̪ʊls̪iːd̪aːs̪]; 1532[1]–1623), also known as Goswami Tulsidas,[5] was a Ramanandi Vaishnava Hindu saint and poet, renowned for his devotion to the deity Rama. He wrote several popular works in Sanskrit and Awadhi, but is best known as the author of the epic Ramcharitmanas, a retelling of the Sanskrit Ramayana based on Rama's life in the vernacular Awadhi.
